File libsrc/libgobject/Array.c

GObject for holding the data as float[] arrays. 
  typedef struct
  {
 	GObjectPart		core;
 
 	float			data[][];	|
 	int			data_length;	|
 	int			size;		| -- Array members
 	double			tbeg;		|
 	double			tend;		|
 	double			tdel;		|
  } *Array;

See Also:

Public Function Index

new_Array (int, double, double)
Create an Array object.
Array_add (Array, float *)
Add an array to an Array object.

Public Functions

new_Array 
 Array new_Array(int data_length,
                 double tbeg,
                 double tdel)
Create an Array object. An Array holds one or more float[] arrays. The Array is created with no arrays and Array_add is called to add arrays. All array lengths must be the same.

Parameters:
data_length - The length of the arrays that will be added.
tbeg - The start time of the arrays that will be added.
tdel - The sample time increment.
Returns:
An Array object, or NULL if malloc fails (logErrorMsg is called).
Array_add 
 int Array_add(Array a,
               float *data)
Add an array to an Array object.

Parameters:
a - An Array object.
data - a float[] array of length a->data_length.
Returns:
0 for success, -1 if malloc failed (logErrorMsg is called).
